s.text: Perhaps the trump testimony was that of an 82-year-old priest telling of the IRS' erroneous attempt to grab $18,000 from a trust fund for the poor set up by his dead mother.
The paper calls the hearings "unprecedented" and includes details from witness accounts of being hounded by overzealous and incompetent agents.

Also, the Post gets so caught up it quoted one Wall St. guru as saying the merged company has "all the ingredients to be competitive with the bulge-bracket firms," but forgets to explain what that term means.
